intro: Cryptantha globulifera, commonly known as the globe-headed cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its globular flower heads that resemble small globes. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cryptantha globulifera is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
